course.title: The Philosopher and the Tyrant
course.meeting_text: Tu., 2-4, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: Philosophers and politicians alike struggle to set the terms for living a good life in a world of conflict. How do court counselors and professional philosophers speak truth to power? How do rulers - and citizens like ourselves - weigh the competing demands of liberty and order, self-fulfillment and self-restraint? Moving from Plato and the Bible to responses to Hitler's Mein Kampf, this course will examine particularly rich examples of relations between the pursuit of wisdom and the pursuit of power, from the extremes of conflict (the executions of Socrates, Jesus, Sir Thomas More) to the opposite dream of the philosopher king.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
